# ch-01

## simple loop

Matloff says to keep it simple, so prefer oddcount1 over oddcount2.

```{r}
oddcount1 <- function(x) {
  k <- 0
  for (n in x) {
    if (n %% 2 == 1) k <- k + 1
  }
  return(k)
}

oddcount2 <- function(x) {
  k <- 0
  for (i in 1:length(x)) {
    if (x[i] %% 2 == 1) k <- k + 1
  }
  return(k)
}
```

## vectorise

Could also get rid of the loop entirely.

```{r}
oddcount3 <- function(x) {
  sum(x %% 2 == 1)
}
```

## speed test

```{r}
library(microbenchmark)

x <- sample(1:200, 50)
mb <- microbenchmark(
  "simple" = oddcount1(x),
  "c--ish" = oddcount2(x),
  "vector" = oddcount3(x)
)

mb
```
